title: Patriots place CB Alex Austin on injured reserve, make 2 practice squad moves
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Austin will be out for a while and a familiar face returns to the practice squad.
Alex Austin.
Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff The Patriots will be without cornerback Alex Austin for the next four games.

title: Woman, 55, charged with killing mother-in-law in New Hampshire, officials say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Crime Her daughter-in-law was charged with second degree murder for allegedly "inflicting blunt head trauma," the AG said.
A woman was arrested in Maine in connection to the February murder of her mother-in-law in Exeter, New Hampshire, the state Attorney General announced.

Danielle Kelsen, 55, was charged with second degree murder, with Attorney General John Formella’s office alleging that she “recklessly caused the death of Janet Kelsen under circumstances manifesting an extreme indifference to the value of human life by inflicting blunt head trauma.

title: Saugus police seek two suspects in mall assault against mother and children
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News The two suspects are described as 18 to 20 year old men wearing all black clothing, black beanie hats, and black masks, police said.

Saugus Police Department By Sana Muneer November 25, 2025 | 6:55 PM 1 minute to read Saugus police are seeking the public’s assistance in identifying two men who allegedly assaulted a woman and her three children Monday night in the parking lot of Square One Mall.
The woman and her children had exited the mall around 8:30 p.

title: ‘I snapped’: North Adams man accused of murdering parents, arson
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Crime Crews responded to a fire, where two elderly people were found dead.
Their son confessed to assaulting them and setting the house ablaze.
By Molly Farrar November 25, 2025 | 6:44 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: West Boylston police investigating early morning break-ins at local gyms
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime Police said they have noticed an increase in break-ins which have resulted in personal belongings being stolen.
West Boylston police are looking for answers after several early morning break-ins at local gyms.
West Boylston Police Department By Darin Zullo November 25, 2025 | 6:11 PM 1 minute to read Police in West Boylston are warning the public about an increase in car break-ins at the town’s gyms.

title: Body found off Boston’s Castle Island
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News A body was found Monday morning in the water off Castle Island in South Boston, according to police.
By Sana Muneer November 25, 2025 | 5:28 PM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A body was found Monday morning in the water off Castle Island in South Boston, according to police.

title: Fired Boston police officer awarded $1 million after alleging sexual harassment
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News Enxhi Qirici alleged colleagues commented about wanting to sleep with her and speculated about whether she was pregnant.
A flag outside Boston Police Department headquarters.
Craig F.

title: Morgan Geekie maps out doubts, belief, and motivation that fueled a breakout year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "I know what I can do and the player that I've grown into.
… I know that I can be a good player in this league.
" Morgan Geekie is on pace for 58 goals this season.

title: Union Oyster House named North America’s best landmark restaurant
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Restaurants This is the third year now that Boston's storied Union Oyster House has won an award for North America's best landmark restaurant.
Union Oyster House was named North America's best landmark restaurant.
Jessica Rinaldi/Globe Staff Another global gastronomy award has recognized a storied restaurant in Boston known for serving New England seafood for nearly two centuries.

title: Mashpee Boy Scouts carry injured woman down N.H. mountain
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News Brodie Perry and Jack Borowski carried the woman for two hours down to the base of the mountain.
From left, Brodie Perry and Jack Borowski.
Paul Perry Two members of the Mashpee Boy Scouts of America Troop 36 carried an injured woman down Mount Lafayette in New Hampshire over Indigenous Peoples’ Day weekend.
